alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 23 at 2:45AM MST until June 23 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON MST /1 PM MDT/ TODAY TO 8 PM MST /9 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES FOR PORTIONS OF CENTRAL NAVAJO COUNTY AND MUCH OF APACHE COUNTY NORTH OF THE WHITE MOUNTAINS... The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a Red Flag Warning due to strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon MST /1 PM MDT/ today to 8 PM MST /9 PM MDT/ this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Locations near Buffalo Pass, Dilkon, Eagar, Springerville, Ganado, Holbrook, Kykotsmovi, Saint Johns, Snowflake, Taylor, Window Rock and Winslow. * WINDS...Southwest 15 to 25 mph, with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 4 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low humidity can cause fire to rapidly grow in size and intensity before first responders can contain them.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring or are imminent. A combination of strong winds and low relative humidities can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Please notify field crews of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264
